issue.title: Shift towards Python 3 to the extent possible on Python 2.7

content.raw:
I don't read it that way, more that `six` is one of the only practical ways to support 2.6 and 3, whereas there are several options for 2.7 and 3. But I think `modernize` or `futurize` is a better option (see below in that page).

Nonetheless, I think this issue is resolved as I envisioned it. *Actually* supporting 3 is a separate issue (and would need to address installation of the C loader first). Can you please resolve this issue, @ericr86?
